results.title: Canada's Atlantic Provinces
results.brief_description: Surrounded by the ocean, dotted with inland lakes and rivers, water plays a major role in the four provinces of New Brunswick, Nova Scotia, Prince Edward Island and Newfoundland, whose inhabitants are mainly of French and British origin. Many of the people continue to lead isolated lives adequately supporting themselves by farming, fishing and lumbering.

results.title: Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Geography of the Americas”.
This film discusses the cities, industries, agriculture and natural resources of each of the major geographical divisions of Canada. While the film looks at the western region, the central prairies, the Great Lakes region, the Maritime Provinces and the Yukon, it also points out similarities between Canada and the United States.

results.title: Can you stop the music?
results.brief_description: A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.This documentary asks local councils, residential associations and live music venue operators to give their views on the impact that inner-city gentrification has had on the live music scene in Melbourne. The once strong scene has seen a decline in the number of venues due to the increasing demand for inner city living.

results.title: Can you spare a moment?: the counselling interview (NP)
results.brief_description: This program featuring John Cleese vividly illustrates the various well-worn techniques managers use when handling a staff member with a problem. It shows the four vital stages to an effective counselling interview - Setting up the interview; Helping them think it through; Encouraging people to talk; and Letting them find a solution. Cast also includes Prunella Scales, David Robb, Art Malik, Joanne Whalley.

results.title: Can You Hear Me?
results.creator_credit: John Fitzgerald, New South Wales. Coal Board and Impact Films
results.brief_description: How to protect our amazingly sensitive hearing from the hazard of noise at the workplace. Animation and live action reveal detail of the inner ear where excessive noise can cause permanent deafness. A guideline allows workers to assess dangerous noise levels where ear protection must be worn. Shows adverse social consequences of noise deafness, with straight answers from a doctor.

results.title: Can we please have that the right way round? (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Features John Cleese and James Cossins preparing a slide presentation and looking back at a series of past disasters. It contains the basic rules of slide presentation and operation in a form designed to stop anyone who sees it from ever making the classic mistakes again. Writer: Dennis Nordern.
